panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: mailroom Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: mailroom Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="emailsProcessed",monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="emailsProcessed",monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="emailsProcessed",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="mailroom"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="emailsProcessed",monitor="global",type="mailroom"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""

  or

    "period", "6h", "", ""

)

panels.title: emailsProcessed SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

Monitors incoming emails delivered from the imap inbox and processed through Sidekiq's `EmailReceiverWorker`.
Note that since Mailroom has poor observability, we use Sidekiq metrics for this, and this could lead to certain Sidekiq problems
being attributed to Mailroom



### Observability Tools

* [ðŸ“– Kibana: Mailroom logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.action,json.to_be_delivered.count,json.byte_size),filters:!(),index:'66d3cd70-6923-11ea-8617-2347010d3aab')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“– Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.class,json.queue,json.meta.project,json.job_status,json.scheduling_latency_s,json.duration_s),filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker))))))),index:'AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“– Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers failed request logs](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/discover?_a=(columns:!(json.class,json.queue,json.meta.project,json.job_status,json.scheduling_latency_s,json.duration_s),filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker)))))),(meta:(key:json.job_status,params:fail,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.job_status:(query:fail,type:phrase))))),index:'AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l')&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker))))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers failed requests](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker)))))),(meta:(key:json.job_status,params:fail,type:phrase),query:(match:(json.job_status:(query:fail,type:phrase))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(),schema:metric,type:count),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers sum latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker))))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_s),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.meta.project.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.duration_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers sum latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker))))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_s),schema:metric,type:sum),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.meta.project.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderBy:'1',otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'Sum+Request+Duration:+json.duration_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers percentile latency aggregated](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker))))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_s,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.duration_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
* [ðŸ“ˆ Kibana: Sidekiq receiver workers percentile latency aggregated (split)](https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/app/kibana#/visualize/create?type=line&indexPattern=AWNABDRwNDuQHTm2tH6l&_a=(filters:!((meta:(key:json.class,params:!(EmailReceiverWorker,ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker),type:phrases),query:(bool:(minimum_should_match:1,should:!((match_phrase:(json.class:EmailReceiverWorker)),(match_phrase:(json.class:ServiceDeskEmailReceiverWorker))))))),query:(language:kuery,query:''),vis:(aggs:!((enabled:!t,id:'1',params:(field:json.duration_s,percents:!(95)),schema:metric,type:percentiles),(enabled:!t,id:'2',params:(drop_partials:!t,extended_bounds:(),field:json.time,interval:auto,min_doc_count:1,scaleMetricValues:!f,timeRange:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}'),useNormalizedEsInterval:!t),schema:segment,type:date_histogram),(enabled:!t,id:'3',params:(field:json.meta.project.keyword,missingBucket:!f,missingBucketLabel:Missing,order:desc,orderAgg:(enabled:!t,id:'3-orderAgg',params:(field:json.duration_s),schema:orderAgg,type:sum),orderBy:custom,otherBucket:!t,otherBucketLabel:Other,size:5),schema:group,type:terms)),params:(valueAxes:!((id:'ValueAxis-1',name:'LeftAxis-1',position:left,scale:(mode:normal,type:linear),show:!t,style:(),title:(text:'p95+Request+Duration:+json.duration_s'),type:value)))))&_g=(time:(from:'${__from:date:iso}',to:'${__to:date:iso}')))
panels.title: Details

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
Records the total memory utilization for containers for this service, as a percentage of
the memory limit as configured through Kubernetes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="mailroom", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|imports|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
